com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.delegate

Interface BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of MvpView
    P - The type of MvpPresenter
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActivityMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, ActivityMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>, BaseMvpViewStateDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpViewStateViewGroupDelegateCallback<V,P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MvpActivity, MvpFragment, MvpFrameLayout, MvpLceActivity, MvpLceFragment, MvpLceViewStateActivity, MvpLceViewStateFragment, MvpLinearLayout, MvpRelativeLayout, MvpViewStateActivity, MvpViewStateFragment, MvpViewStateFrameLayout, MvpViewStateLinearLayout, MvpViewStateRelativeLayout

    public interface BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
    The MvpDelegate callback that will be called from FragmentMvpDelegate or ViewGroupMvpDelegate. This interface must be implemented by all Fragment or android.view.View that you want to support mosbys mvp. Please note that Activties need a special callback ActivityMvpDelegateCallback
    Since:
    1.1.0
    See Also:
    ActivityMvpDelegateCallback

    • Method Detail

      • createPresenter

        P createPresenter()
        Creates the presenter instance
        Returns:
        the created presenter instance

      • getPresenter

        P getPresenter()
        Get the presenter. If null is returned, then a internally a new presenter instance gets created by calling createPresenter()
        Returns:
        the presenter instance. can be null.

      • setPresenter

        void setPresenter(P presenter)
        Sets the presenter instance
        Parameters:
        presenter - The presenter instance

      • getMvpView

        V getMvpView()
        Get the MvpView for the presenter
        Returns:
        The view associated with the presenter

      • isRetainInstance

        boolean isRetainInstance()
        Indicate whether the retain instance feature is enabled by this view or not
        Returns:
        true if the view has enabled retaining, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        setRetainInstance(boolean)

      • setRetainInstance

        void setRetainInstance(boolean retainingInstance)
        Mark this instance as retaining. This means that the feature of a retaining instance is enabled.
        Parameters:
        retainingInstance - true if retaining instance feature is enabled, otherwise false
        See Also:
        isRetainInstance()

      • shouldInstanceBeRetained

        boolean shouldInstanceBeRetained()
        Indicates whether or not the the view will be retained during next screen orientation change. This boolean flag is used for MvpPresenter.detachView(boolean) as parameter. Usually you should take Activity#isChangingConfigurations() into account. The difference between shouldInstanceBeRetained() and isRetainInstance() is that isRetainInstance() indicates that retain instance feature is enabled or disabled while shouldInstanceBeRetained() indicates if the view is going to be destroyed permanently and hence should no more be retained (i.e. Activity is finishing and not just screen orientation changing)
        Returns:
        true if the instance should be retained, otherwise false
